[/quote]Or you just downloaded a anti-leech one, there are still public void sM and many other stuff[/quote]
thats how i fixed anti leech

item.source: Staff higher lvl limit than normal players?

item.title: Staff higher lvl limit than normal players?
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

You can make a method that returns the max level for a certain rank.

private int getMaxLvlForRank() {
    switch(playerRights) {
        case 0:
            return 99; // this will be for normal players

        case 1:
            return 126; // this will be for mods

        case 2:
            return 150; // this will be for admins
    }
}

And then use that method.

	public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
		int points = 0;
		int output = 0;

		for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= getMaxLvlForRank(); lvl++) {
			points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 150.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
			output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
			if (output >= exp) {
				return lvl;
			}
		}
		return getMaxLvlForRank();
	}

Read full topic
item.source: Staff higher lvl limit than normal players?

item.title: Staff higher lvl limit than normal players?
item.dc:creator: @manmanner manmanner
item.description:
@manmanner wrote:

how do i modify this code to make mods go higher than lvl 99 but still put ordinary players limit at 99?

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) { int points = 0; int output = 0; if (exp > 13034431) return 99; for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) { points += Math.floor((double) lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0)); output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4); if (output >= exp) { return lvl; } } return 0; }
i already tried anything i can think of

Read full topic
